intro: Polycnemum scleranthoides, commonly known as the broadleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers that develop into burr-like structures. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a rough texture. Polycnemum scleranthoides is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects.
